TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TraceEventCache extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides trace event data specific to a thread and a process.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache> class, designed as a performance optimization for trace listener calls, is of interest only to developers creating custom trace listeners.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache> class is used as a parameter in tracing methods to accurately identify the source of a trace event. Examples of methods that use <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache> are <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceListener.TraceEvent%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceFilter.ShouldTrace%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>. The <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache.LogicalOperationStack%2A> property contains data that can be used to correlate the trace with related traces.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Callstack As String
public: property System::String ^ Callstack { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the call stack for the current thread.
Docs.value: A string containing stack trace information. This value can be an empty string ("").

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache.Callstack%2A> property gets the call stack from the <xref:System.Environment.StackTrace%2A> property of the <xref:System.Environment> class. The property value lists method calls in reverse chronological order. That is, the most recent method call is described first. One line of stack trace information is listed for each method call on the stack. For more information, see <xref:System.Environment.StackTrace%2A>.

Docs.permission: for full access to the resource protected by the permission. Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DateTime As DateTime
public: property DateTime DateTime { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the date and time at which the event trace occurred.
Docs.value: A structure whose value is a date and time expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The first time the property is accessed in an instance of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceEventCache> class, the current time is returned. Subsequent queries of this property in that instance return that same <xref:System.DateTime> value, allowing it to be used as a timestamp.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LogicalOperationStack As Stack
public: property System::Collections::Stack ^ LogicalOperationStack { System::Collections::Stack ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the correlation data, contained in a stack.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The correlation data is stored as an object in the call context with the name "System.Diagnostics.Trace.CorrelationManagerSlot". The <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager> class provides methods used to store a logical operation identity in a thread-bound context and automatically tag each trace event generated by the thread with the stored identity. The <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager> is accessed through the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace.CorrelationManager%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. Each call to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager.StartLogicalOperation%2A> method pushes a new logical operation identity onto the stack. Each call to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager.StopLogicalOperation%2A> method pops a logical operation identity from the stack

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProcessId As Integer
public: property int ProcessId { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the current process.
Docs.value: The system-generated unique identifier of the current process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Until the process terminates, the process identifier uniquely identifies the process throughout the system.

Docs.permission: for the ability to call unmanaged code. Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ThreadId As String
public: property System::String ^ ThreadId { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the current managed thread.
Docs.value: A string that represents a unique integer identifier for this managed thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The thread identifier is the value of the <xref:System.Threading.Thread.ManagedThreadId%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property formatted as a string.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Timestamp As Long
public: property long Timestamp { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current number of ticks in the timer mechanism.
Docs.value: The tick counter value of the underlying timer mechanism.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The get accessor calls the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.GetTimestamp%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get the timestamp. If the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch> class uses a high-resolution performance counter, <xref:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.GetTimestamp%2A> returns the current value of that counter. If the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch> class uses the system timer, <xref:System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch.GetTimestamp%2A> returns the <xref:System.DateTime.Ticks%2A> property of <xref:System.DateTime.Now%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
